verses.kjv: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,
verses.web: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon, our beloved fellow worker,
verses.ct: From Paul, a prisoner for Christ Jesus, and from Timothy our brother — to Philemon, our dear friend and fellow worker:

verses.kjv: And to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:
verses.web: to the beloved Apphia, to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the assembly in your house:
verses.ct: To our dear Apphia, to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church that meets in your house:

verses.kjv: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.web: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: May grace and peace be yours from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,
verses.web: I thank my God always, making mention of you in my prayers,
verses.ct: I always thank my God whenever I mention you in my prayers,

verses.kjv: Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;
verses.web: hearing of your love and of the faith which you have toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all the saints,
verses.ct: because I keep hearing about your love and your faith — your faith toward the Lord Jesus and your love for all God's people.

verses.kjv: That the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.
verses.web: that the fellowship of your faith may become effective in the knowledge of every good thing which is in us in Christ Jesus.
verses.ct: I pray that as you share your faith, it will deepen your understanding of every good thing we have in Christ Jesus.

verses.kjv: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.
verses.web: For we have much joy and comfort in your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you, brother.
verses.ct: Your love has brought me so much joy and encouragement, brother, because you have refreshed the hearts of God's people.

verses.kjv: Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,
verses.web: Therefore though I have all boldness in Christ to command you that which is appropriate,
verses.ct: So even though I could be bold enough in Christ to order you to do what's right,

verses.kjv: Yet for love’s sake I rather beseech thee, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.
verses.web: yet for love’s sake I rather beg, being such a one as Paul, the aged, but also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: I'd rather appeal to you out of love. I'm asking as Paul — an old man now, and also a prisoner for Christ Jesus.

verses.kjv: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:
verses.web: I beg you for my child, whom I have become the father of in my chains, Onesimus,
verses.ct: I'm appealing to you on behalf of Onesimus, who became like a son to me while I was in chains.

verses.kjv: Which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:
verses.web: who once was useless to you, but now is useful to you and to me.
verses.ct: There was a time when he was useless to you, but now he's become useful to both you and me.

verses.kjv: Whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:
verses.web: I am sending him back. Therefore receive him, that is, my own heart,
verses.ct: I'm sending him back to you — and with him goes my very heart.

verses.kjv: Whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:
verses.web: whom I desired to keep with me, that on your behalf he might serve me in my chains for the Good News.
verses.ct: I would have loved to keep him here with me so he could serve me on your behalf while I'm in chains for the gospel.

verses.kjv: But without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.
verses.web: But I was willing to do nothing without your consent, that your goodness would not be as of necessity, but of free will.
verses.ct: But I didn't want to do anything without your consent. That way, any kindness you show wouldn't be forced — it would be freely given.

verses.kjv: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;
verses.web: For perhaps he was therefore separated from you for a while, that you would have him forever,
verses.ct: Maybe the reason he was separated from you for a while was so you could have him back forever —

verses.kjv: Not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?
verses.web: no longer as a slave, but more than a slave, a beloved brother, especially to me, but how much rather to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.
verses.ct: no longer as a slave, but as something far better than a slave: a beloved brother. He's especially dear to me, but how much more should he be to you, both as a person and as a fellow believer in the Lord.

verses.kjv: If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.
verses.web: If then you count me a partner, receive him as you would receive me.
verses.ct: So if you consider me your partner, welcome him the same way you'd welcome me.

verses.kjv: If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on mine account;
verses.web: But if he has wronged you at all or owes you anything, put that to my account.
verses.ct: If he's wronged you in any way or owes you anything, charge it to me.

verses.kjv: I Paul have written it with mine own hand, I will repay it: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.
verses.web: I, Paul, write this with my own hand: I will repay it (not to mention to you that you owe to me even your own self besides).
verses.ct: I, Paul, am writing this with my own hand: I will pay it back. And I won't even mention that you owe me your very self.

verses.kjv: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.
verses.web: Yes, brother, let me have joy from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in the Lord.
verses.ct: Yes, brother — let me benefit from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in Christ.

verses.kjv: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.
verses.web: Having confidence in your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even beyond what I say.
verses.ct: I'm writing to you with full confidence that you'll do what I ask — and even more than I'm asking.

verses.kjv: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.
verses.web: Also, prepare a guest room for me, for I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you.
verses.ct: One more thing: get a guest room ready for me, because I'm hoping that through your prayers, God will bring me back to you.

verses.kjv: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;
verses.web: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you,
verses.ct: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends you his greetings,

verses.kjv: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.
verses.web: as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.
verses.ct: and so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke — my fellow workers.

verses.kjv: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
verses.web: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
verses.ct: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
